alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 11:44PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CROCKETT AND SOUTHWESTERN SUTTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1230 AM CDT... At 1143 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of The Intersection Of Highway 163 And Ranch Road 1973, or 16 miles northwest of Juno, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Crockett and southwestern Sutton Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
